item.title: Free vs Open-Source Software
item.description: If you are totally unaware of these terms, it’s fine. You might have heard about FOSS though. FOSS is generally associated as opposite of proprietary software. Let’s dig a bit deeper than that. What is FOSS? FOSS i.e Free and Open Source Software, is any piece of software that is freely licenced to use,study,copy and modify and the source-code is openly shared so that people are encouraged to voluntarily contribute to it.
